hero.title: Scam Trends
hero.subtitle: Stay informed about the latest scams.

scamOfTheWeek.name: HMRC Phishing Email Scam
scamOfTheWeek.description: Fake emails claiming to be from HMRC offer tax refunds, directing users to phishing sites to steal personal information.
scamOfTheWeek.action: Do not click links; verify with HMRC at www.gov.uk.

scamCategories.name: Imposter Scams
scamCategories.description: Fraudsters pose as HMRC, banks, or delivery services to trick victims into sharing information or making payments.
scamCategories.action: Hang up or delete; contact the entity directly using official details.

scamCategories.name: Crypto Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake crypto platforms promise high returns, using AI-generated testimonials to lure victims into investing.
scamCategories.action: Avoid unsolicited investment offers; research platforms thoroughly.
scamCategories.source: GetFocal.ai 2025 Fraud Trends, User-Reported Trend (Verified by Scam Checker Team)

scamCategories.name: Phishing Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake emails or texts posing as PayPal or Royal Mail steal login credentials or financial information.
scamCategories.action: Do not click links; verify with the company using official channels.
scamCategories.source: ONS 2022 Data, User-Reported Trend (Verified by Scam Checker Team)

scamCategories.name: Investment Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake trading platforms or Ponzi schemes on social media promise guaranteed returns, often using deepfake ads.
scamCategories.action: Be cautious of social media ads; verify investments with a financial advisor.
scamCategories.source: ASA 2024 Scam Ad Trends, Which? 2025 Scam Predictions

scamCategories.name: Romance Scams
scamCategories.description: Scammers on dating platforms build trust, then request money for emergencies or travel expenses.
scamCategories.action: Never send money to someone you havenâ€™t met; report to the platform.

scamCategories.name: Social Media Scams
scamCategories.description: Fraudsters use fake profiles or ads on social media platforms like Instagram or TikTok to trick users into sharing personal information or making payments.
scamCategories.action: Verify profiles and offers; report suspicious activity to the platform.

scamCategories.name: Tech Support Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake tech support calls or pop-ups claim your device is infected and request payment for fixes.
redFlags: Requests for remote access or payment
scamCategories.action: Hang up or close pop-ups; contact official tech support directly.

scamCategories.name: Purchase Scams
scamCategories.description: Online sellers offer fake or non-existent products, taking payment without delivering.
redFlags: Prices too good to be true
scamCategories.action: Use secure payment platforms; report to the marketplace.

scamCategories.name: Family Emergency Scams
scamCategories.description: Scammers pose as family members in distress, requesting urgent money transfers.
scamCategories.action: Verify directly with family members; report to authorities.

scamCategories.name: Advance Fee Scams
scamCategories.description: Scammers promise large rewards (e.g., loans or lottery winnings) in exchange for upfront fees.
scamCategories.action: Avoid paying upfront fees; report to Action Fraud.

scamCategories.name: Fake Charity Scams
scamCategories.description: Fraudsters solicit donations for fake charities, often after disasters.
scamCategories.action: Verify charities via official websites; report suspicious requests.

scamCategories.name: Job Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake job offers request payment for training or equipment before employment.
scamCategories.action: Verify job offers directly with the company; avoid paying upfront.

scamCategories.name: Delivery Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake delivery notifications request payment or personal details to release packages.
scamCategories.action: Verify with the delivery service; report suspicious messages.

scamCategories.name: Rental Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake rental listings trick tenants into paying deposits for non-existent properties.
redFlags: Deals too good to be true
scamCategories.action: View properties in person; use secure payment methods.

scamCategories.name: Subscription Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake subscriptions trick users into recurring payments for unwanted services.
scamCategories.action: Review terms before subscribing; contact your bank to cancel payments.

scamCategories.name: QR Code Scams
scamCategories.description: Fake QR codes in public places lead to phishing sites or fraudulent payments.
scamCategories.action: Avoid scanning unknown QR codes; verify URLs before proceeding.

weeklyStats.source: UK Finance 2023 Annual Fraud Report, Cifas Fraudscape 2024 Report, ONS 2022 Data

quickAlerts.name: Fake HMRC Tax Refund Emails
quickAlerts.description: Emails claiming tax refunds lead to phishing sites stealing personal information.

quickAlerts.name: Royal Mail Delivery Fee Scam
quickAlerts.description: Texts claiming a delivery fee is needed to reschedule a missed delivery lead to phishing sites.
quickAlerts.action: Verify with Royal Mail at www.royalmail.com.

quickAlerts.name: AI Celebrity Endorsement Scam
quickAlerts.description: AI-generated ads on Instagram featuring celebrities promote fake investment schemes.
quickAlerts.action: Be cautious of social media ads; verify investments with a financial advisor.

quickAlerts.name: Crypto Recovery Scam
quickAlerts.description: Scammers target previous crypto scam victims, demanding upfront fees to recover losses.
quickAlerts.action: Avoid unsolicited offers; report to Action Fraud.

quickAlerts.name: Deepfake Video Call Scam
quickAlerts.description: Deepfake video calls pretending to be bank officials trick victims into sharing information.
quickAlerts.action: Verify identities directly with your bank using official channels.

userReportedScams.name: Fake PayPal Invoice Scam
userReportedScams.description: Email claiming I owed money for a purchase I never made, linking to a fake PayPal site.
userReportedScams.action: Do not click links; verify with PayPal at www.paypal.com.
userReportedScams.source: User-Reported Trend (Verified by Scam Checker Team)

userReportedScams.name: Royal Mail Text Scam
userReportedScams.description: Text claiming I missed a delivery and needed to pay a fee to reschedule, linking to a phishing site.
userReportedScams.action: Verify with Royal Mail at www.royalmail.com.
userReportedScams.source: User-Reported Trend (Verified by Scam Checker Team)

userReportedScams.name: Crypto Investment Scam
userReportedScams.description: Instagram ad promised high returns on a crypto platform; after investing, the platform disappeared.
userReportedScams.action: Avoid unsolicited investment offers; report to the platform.
userReportedScams.source: User-Reported Trend (Verified by Scam Checker Team)

userReportedScams.name: Phishing Email Scam
userReportedScams.description: Received an email pretending to be from my bank asking for login details.
userReportedScams.action: Do not respond; verify with your bank directly.
userReportedScams.source: User-Reported Trend (Verified by Scam Checker Team)
